page.title: 06CHENIES VILLAGE.
page.content: When the Duke of Bedford's estate was split up and sold for auction in 1954, much of it was purchased by a property developer who hoped to be allowed to build more housing on the land. However this was not allowed,and many of the properties were then resold to those who already rented them.In this way some of the farms continued as they had been previously run. However there has been a gradual 'Gentrification' of the farms,with many of the large farmhouses being converted to private residences,and old farm workers cottages changed to farm housing.Also outhouses have been converted to housing and land rented to neighbouring farms.In this way the character of the village and its farms has changed dramatically.
